pros: Consistent and attentive staff. Nice atmosphere to work in.
cons: Too many upper level staff that decrease hands on health care personnel.
Pay was not the best to start out.

review_title: Great if you arent in dining
pros: Coworkers and residents are typically great to work with
cons:
the managers take the supervisors side no matter what, even if they receive several complaints. 
The whole dining department’s based on favoritism. Higher ups are kinda sexists. Working with the cooks you often hear very sexist and racist jokes. The director of dining sticks his hands in the food every day when he walks by as he says “whats for lunch”, contaminating the whole bunch of food. 
If you apply for a certain shift, don’t agree to ever working outside of that shift. If you apply wanting mornings and say “I can work a few evenings here and there if absolutely necessary”. All they hear is “okay two nights a week”

pros: I loved my time here-- made great connections and memories.
cons: Didn't love the food too much, and some supervisors were worse than others. All in all, a great job though

review_title: Best Nursing Home in Boulder County
pros: Staff is caring and residents is a mix of rehab and long-term care. Clean and well maintained facility with activities and good dining options for the residents.
cons: Becoming a corporation even though it is a non-profit. More rules and less of a homelike feeling for staff and residents.

pros: Only pro to the job is meeting the residents.
cons: The employers themselves are very sexist. I’ve never worked somewhere where I felt as horrible as I did here. I was discriminated against on a daily basis. My managers/directors never believed a word I said because I’m a woman who barely has a voice. I would speak up and get shut down. I would be told to allow myself to be disrespected if it was my supervisor who was disrespecting me, because he was a man and he was going NOWHERE FOR AS LONG AS HE WANTS TO STAY THERE. That man whom I reported on a daily basis continues to verbally assault the other female employees because he feels entitled to do so. He speaks harshly to them and even uses profanity while speaking. He then proceeds to tell his manager and his manager ALWAYS takes his side, there’s never been a time when we’d be asked our side of the story, we’d be told to shut up and suck it up because we’re simply SERVERS Who are women. I don’t stand for this job. I hope they change their ways. It’s truly disgusting how they treat people. And they will probably continue to do so as long as the dinning management stays the same. I sincerely hope you get them out of there before they make more people suffer and dread going into a job that doesn’t even pay well. We don’t have a choice but to suck it up and work because we need the money. But we shouldn’t have to put up with the horrible toxicity of Frasier Meadows and the horrible verbal harassment I’ve had to go through.

pros: Good starter job for high school and college students
cons: Bad managers/inexperienced managers who act they have experience

pros: This is a great community to work within. You are treated like family and attach to the other employees as well as the residents very quickly
cons: Because it is such a clost knit community it can be hard to grow quickly because turnover is not incredibly high in the management or supervisory roles.

pros: Residents and staff are nice. Enjoyed working with older adults.
cons: Management are in positions that they should not be in. CEO is all about filling the apartments, at whatever cost. Staff are not supported. Poor communication, lack of support. Staff are left out to hang. Managementt is doing shady things, unethical things that are impacting residents' care.

pros: This is a great place to work as a CNA. The staff to patient ratio is second to none, and we are all passionate about giving the best care possible. It's very rare that I have a problem with my coworkers, and management is responsive to problems that are brought up.
cons: CNA pay could be higher, but it's competitive with other locations in the area.

pros: People are family oriented. Provide quality care to residents. Have a great kitchen with great cooks and servers. Thumbs up!
cons: PRN schedule. My commute was long.Working the over night shift was hard to get used too. Night rounds were no fun.

pros: Great team and good support. Old people will tell you the best stories.
cons: Management could be better by actually listening to their employee's needs and wants.

review_title: Not even quite sure where to start.
cons:
Micromanaging 
Racism within the campus 
Unfair scheduling 
Kitchen is always understaffed 
Unfair workload
Toxic people and at times unsafe work environment 
Manipulative culture 
So on..
